_header: Our gracious God prince of pity
_description: William Lychefelde, ‘Complaint of God’ — sixty-eight 8-line stanzas (abababab)

OxfCCC237.First Lines:
Pure gracius god prynce of pyteWhoys myghte who Whois
                    goodnesse neuer began…
OxfCCC237.Last Lines:
…And to a byde with þe in blysThate euyr schall laste
                    with owtyn ende

CULFf238.First Lines:
…And þerfore man whyles þu mayMake amendys or
                    þat þou dyeI wot wele lord from ȝeere to ȝeerefful
                    gretely greued the y haue…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…That to þe chosen ordeyned ysThat leuen synne and
                    þen amende
CULFf238.Note: Missing lines 1-158 due to loss of folios 1-2.
CULFf238.Attributed Title: Here endyth þe compleynt of god… (f. 6)
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
CULFf238.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard. 
             The Poems of John Audelay.
Percy Society
         14. London: Richards, 1844: 87-8.

CamGon174.First Lines:
Oovre gracious god prynce of piteThat all this worlde fyrst be
                    gan…
CamGon174.Last Lines:
…That to thy chosyn ordeyned ysÞat leve there synne &
                    them amende
CamGon174.Attributed Title:
Explicit tractatus compilatus per Magistrum Willelmum lychefelde
                        doctorem Theologie (p. 480)
CamGon174.Editions:
Borgström,  Edvard. 
             “The Complaint of God to Sinful Man and the Answer of Man by William
                Lichfield.” 
             Anglia
         34 (1911): 498-525: 508-25.
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 3-4 (lines 385-448 only, treated as a separate
                        work).

CamMagPep1584.First Lines:
Oure gracious god prince of piteWhois myght and godenes neuer be
                    ganAt whois wyll all by houyth to becompleynyth hym thus to synfull
                    man…
CamMagPep1584.Last Lines:
…That to þi chosyn ordenyd isThat lenyth syn and them
                    amend
CamMagPep1584.Note:
Roughly 68 stanzas, most of 8 lines, but some of 6 and some of 4
                    lines.
CamMagPep1584.Attributed Title:
The compleynt of god (Tab. of Contents, f. 1); The complaynt of god (RT);
                    Here endith the compleynt of god (f. 13v)

CamTCC601.First Lines:
Oure gracious god prince of pyteOf whom all grace & goodnes
                    beganAt whos wyll all thyng behoueth to beCompleyneth hym thus vnto
                    synfull man…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…And aftyr thys lyfe bryng yow and meVnto euerlastyng
                    ioy
CamTCC601.Attributed Author:
Lydgate (added by later hand, then crossed through, f. 182); William
                    lichefeld doctor of diuinitie (added by hand of the sixteenth century, f. 182);
                    Iohn Lydgate (added by later hand, then crossed through, f. 189); quod lychefeld
                    doctor theologie Here endith þe complaynte betuyxt god & man that was
                    made by magister Willyam lychefeld which was person of all halows þe more
                    in thamis strete in london on whos soule god have mercy… (added by hand of
                    John Stow, f. 189); …he deied in anno 1449 1447 on þe
                    xxiiij of october and made in his tyme 3083 sermons as apered by his owne hand
                    writinge & were found when he was deade (added by later hand of the
                    sixteenth century, f. 189)

BLHar2339.First Lines:
Oure gracious god ful of piteWhos myȝte & goodnes neuer
                    bigan…
BLHar2339.Last Lines:
…Þat to þi chosene ordeyned isMerci ihesu I wole
                    amende
BLHar2339.Attributed Title:
Here sueþ þe complaynte of god of euery synful man & woman
                    (rubricated, f. 81v)

BLAdd36983.First Lines:
Owre gracious god prince of pyteWhos miȝte whos goodnesse
                    neuer [began]…
BLAdd36983.Last Lines:
…Þat to pain chosen & ordeyned ysÞat leuyn synne
                    & hem Amende

NLS1931.First Lines:
…Bot lord þu knowet mannus freltynesHow freyll he is
                    & hasse byn aye…
NLS1931.Last Lines:
…þat to þyn chosen ordyned hisþat levyon hor
                    syn & wolle A mende
NLS1931.Note: Stanzas 1-6 wanting; immediately followed by 2940 as if same work.
NLS1931.Facsimiles:
Hardman,  Phillipa. 
             The Heege Manuscript: A Facsimile of National Library of Scotland MS
                Advocates 19.3.1.
         Leeds Texts and Monographs, n.s. 16. Leeds: School of English,
            2000.

Lam306.First Lines:
Thus oure gracious god prince of pytewhos myght whose goodenes
                    neuer bygan…
Lam306.Last Lines:
And but I wole vse wrenchis wylysto comyn wyse as I shall nat
                    stryve
Lam306.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 198-232.

Lam853.First Lines:
THus oure gracious god prince of piteeWhos miȝt whos goodnes
                    neuere biganAt whos wil al bihoueþ to beCompleyneth him þus
                    to synful man…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…Þat we may bide wiþ þee in blis& wiþ
                    aungils world withouten eendeÞat to be chosen ordeyned ysTo leeue
                    al synne & hem ameendeAmen Amen amen Amen
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 198-232.

HunHM144.First Lines:
O My graciouse god prynce of piteOff whom all grace and goodnesse
                    begann…
HunHM144.Last Lines:
…And after this lyf bryng you and meIn to euerlastynge Ioy
                    Amen
HunHM144.Attributed Author:
Made by William Lichefield doctor of divinitie parson of all hallows in
                    Thamis strete who deceased 1447 (added by later hand, f. 1); Her endithe the
                    complaynte of god to man and was made by magister william lichefield doctor of
                    divinitie and was parson of allhallows the more in thamis strete in london he
                    died in anno 1447 the 14 of october and made in his tyme 3083 sermons as apered
                    by his owne hand writinge and were found whan he was deade (added by later hand,
                    f. 9v)
HunHM144.Attributed Title: Here begynnyth the Compleynte betwene God and Man (f. 1)
